result.markdown:
--- title: Stative verb ‘be’, negative present tense suffix author: Timur Maisak date: 'Last update: 2023-06-04' output: html_document: number_sections: true anchor_sections: true pandoc_args: --shift-heading-level-by=-1 --- In the negative present tense, the stative verbs employ the suffix which is identical to the negative present-tense copula. It is -diš in the majority of varieties (e.g. a-diš ‘is not there’), and -ǯiš in Shinaz. ## Gender 1/4 ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Map ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ## Gender 2 ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Map ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ::: ## Gender 3 ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Map ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: ### Data ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: :::
